description: From Middle French exubérant, from Latin exūberāns, the present active participle of exūberō (“be abundant”). Put together from ex (“out”), and uber (“udder”), and originally would have referred to a cow or she-goat which was making so much milk that it naturally dripped or sprayed from the udder.

adjectives.description: exuberant (comparative more exuberant, superlative most exuberant)

entries.meaning: (of people) Very high-spirited; extremely energetic and enthusiastic.
(literary, of things that grow) Abundant, luxuriant.
